title: Jennifer Aniston at home when man crashed a car into her property’s front gates
summary: A man has been detained after he crashed a car through the gate outside of Jennifer Aniston's home while she was there.
story: A man has been detained after he crashed a car through the gate outside the Los Angeles mansion of Jennifer Aniston on the afternoon of May 5 while she was home, two law enforcement sources tell NBC News.
Aniston, who did not comment on the matter, was not hurt during the incident.

Private security guards for the “Friends” star, 56, detained the man until police arrived on the scene. The driver, who has not been identified, was described by authorities as a middle-aged white male. It’s not known why he crashed into the gate.

Aniston, whose home in the Bel Air neighborhood of Los Angeles has been featured in Architectural Digest, has endured previous security breaches. In 2005, a man took a taxi to a home she was renting in Malibu, California, climbed a fence and broke into the property while she was out of town before the actor’s employees confronted her, the LA district attorney's office told People at the time.

Aniston also got a restraining order against a man suspected of being a stalker who hung out in locations in Los Angeles where he thought she may be, the Los Angeles Times reported in 2010. That man would carry a sharp object, duct tape and love letters to the actor.
Law enforcement sources say the man who crashed into Aniston's front gates on Monday was taken to a hospital. It’s not clear what charges he may face.

The episode at Aniston’s home calls to mind similar incidents for other celebrities. In 2018, a man who was allegedly fixated on Taylor Swift broke into her New York City apartment, where he took a shower while she was not there.
In 2014, Sandra Bullock was home when a man broke into her Los Angeles residence, prompting her to hide in a closet while she called 911.

title: A major trend at the 2025 Met Gala: The classic suit reimagined
summary: In honor of the 2025 Met Gala's dress code, many female celebrities are showing up to the event dressed in suits with a twist.
story: There was one clear theme among women at the 2025 Met Gala: suits!
In honor of this year's dress code, “Tailored For You,” many female celebrities are arriving to the gala dressed in re-interpretations of the classic suit.
Met Gala regular Zendaya arrived wearing a stunning white suit (perhaps a nod to the star entering her bridal era?) and matching hat, all put together by her longtime stylist Law Roach.
"Saturday Night Live" cast member Ego Nwodim also stayed on theme and wore a gorgeous cropped jacket and corset dress with tailored pants.
TV personality Zuri Hall followed suit and showed up in a breathtaking number that looked like a modern day suit.
Not to mention Emma Chamberlain, Teyana Taylor, Zoe Saldaña and a few more stars opted to wear suit-like dresses for the high-profile event as well.
Black fashion expert Kpoene Kofi-Bruce tells TODAY.com that she loves how these celebs are doing a different take on menswear.

“Zuri Hall’s layered take on men’s suiting is a clever combination of all the things we love about menswear (the pinstripe, the expertly-judged lapel) given the Grecian-draping treatment and a little bit of Viktor and Rolf’s trompe l’oeil surface design circa 2023,” she said.
“The mermaid silhouette is also a very traditional shape in Nigerian and Ghanaian formalwear, as is the exaggerated peplum on Ego’s suit.”

As for Nwodim, Kofi-Bruce says she admires how designer Christopher John Rogers took different shapes of traditional men's tailcoats and made it into a "feminine" piece that completed Nwodim perfectly.
Kimberly Jenkins, who is a fashion studies scholar, also tells TODAY.com that Nwodim's look reminds her of how Black women would dress when they go to church on Sundays.
"I remember dress suits for women being very popular in church and it still is," she said.
However, for Zendaya's look, Jenkins said the "Euphoria" star looked as if she was paying homage to Mick Jagger's ex-wife, actor and social activist Bianca Jagger.
“It is very Bianca Jagger, hat and all!” Jenkins said.
Though AK Brown, founder of Advisor magazine, tells TODAY.com that Zendaya's look looked more like an outfit Diahann Carroll would wear instead.
"Zendaya is actually giving me Diahann Carroll," she said. "And Diahann Carroll was very prominent in Black film and entertainment."
According to a press release, the dress code for the 2025 Met Gala is “Tailored For You" and it's “a nod to the exhibition’s focus on suiting and menswear.”
The dress code complements this year's theme — “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style,” which celebrates the concept of Black dandyism.

Pharrell Williams, Lewis Hamilton, Colman Domingo, A$AP Rocky — the Met Gala’s 2025 co-chairs alongside Vogue’s Anna Wintour — were among them. LeBron James, the Met Gala’s 2025 honorary chair, intended to go but said early Monday he would not be there due to a knee injury.
Below, see a complete list of 2025 Met Gala attendees. This story will be updated with photos as guests arrive.

Williams is a well-known music producer, Grammy-winning artist and serves as Louis Vuitton men's creative director.

The Oscar-nominated actor is known for projects such as “Sing Sing” and “Rustin,” and stars in the new Netflix series “Four Seasons.”

Rocky is a Grammy-nominated rapper, actor and entrepreneur. He's also the proud dad of two sons, RZA and Riot, with pop star Rihanna. He confirmed on the Met Gala carpet that Rihanna is pregnant with their third child.

title: See Diana Ross’ stunning Met Gala cape, embroidered with the names of her children and grandchildren
summary: Diana Ross's Met Gala look included a stunning white cape embroidered with the names of her children and grandchildren.
story: For Diana Ross's Met Gala look, the drama is in the details.

The singer commanded attention at the big event when she appeared in a crystal-embellished white gown and a feather-edged cape so long and broad it appeared to take up the entire width of the red carpet and took eight suited handlers to carry and present.
Topping it all off was her signature voluminous tumble of curls beneath a broad, feathery hat.
The former Supremes member explained that her cape includes a special detail.

"It has the names of all my children and my eight grandchildren," she explained. "So everybody's name is embroidered, embroidered in that. And the hat — you know, like, I have to be careful with the hat because my head was pretty big."

Diana Ross revealed that she wasn’t planning to attend but that her son, 36-year-old Evan Ross, who appeared alongside her, persuaded her to take a break and attend despite being in the middle of a tour.
“She’s the best thing of all time,” he said. “She’s the best thing. She is the Met Ball. She — you are the Met Ball, you are the moment.”
In addition to Evan Ross, Diana Ross is the mother of Rhonda Ross Kendrick, actor Tracee Ellis Ross, Chudney Ross and Ross Naess.

"I love that she has her children’s names embroidered on her train, Diana Ross is the queen of main character energy," Kpoene Kofi-Bruce, a tailor and expert on dandyism and the historical era, tells TODAY.com.
"I also love how beautiful she looks in the simple sequined gown underneath."

"Diana Ross’s look is so fabulous!"  Kimberly Jenkins, the director and principal researcher of The Fashion and Race Database, tells TODAY.com about the look. "Aside from being a fashion icon, (Diana) Ross is also known for being in the film 'Mahogany' opposite Billy Dee Williams, which visually articulated the beauty of the black model in fashionable clothes."

"The color white is that when you were looking super fine and even in hip-hop tradition, super fresh, keeping everything white and clean was critical," Jenkins added. "Even with the 1940s tennis star Althea Gibson, she went to great lengths to keep her tennis whites white. The ability to keep your whites white takes a great deal of labor, mindfulness, and stealth when carrying yourself."

title: Former Vice President Kamala Harris attends the 2025 Met Gala
summary: Former Vice President Kamala Harris attended her first Met Gala on May 5, 2025 in New York City wearing a design by Off-White creative director IB Kamara.
story: Former Vice President Kamala Harris is attending her first Met Gala on May 5, 2025 in New York City.
The former presidential candidate wore a custom black and white dress designed by Off-White creative director IB Kamara, as reported by Vogue.
“Art has always had a significant impact on not just culture, but also our policies and politics,” Vogue quoted Harris in their caption ahead of the event.
Just prior Vogue confirmed that she was attending, the Instagram account belonging to the non-profit Fifteen Percent Pledge posted a photo of Harris with Kamara.
"Secrets out: Kamala Harris, the first female vice president and the first Black woman ever to top a major-party ticket is attending the Superfine Met Gala tonight," the post's caption read.

This year’s Met Gala theme, “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style,” was specifically inspired by the 2009 book “Slaves to Fashion: Black Dandyism and the Styling of Black Diasporic Identity” by Monica L. Miller, in which she explores the influence of the Black dandy.
"Mrs. Harris looks elegant and timeless," Black fashion expert Kpoene Kofi-Bruce tells TODAY.com of the former California attorney general's Met Gala look.
"It is a little bit of a departure from her usual preppy pantsuit, but the two-tone and the chocker are surprisingly sexy and sophisticated."

Harris has only recently stepped back into the spotlight after she lost the presidential election to Donald J. Trump in November  2024 and ended her term as Joe Biden's vice president in January 2025.

She gave her first public speech since January just last week, on April 30, at the Emerge 20th Anniversary Gala in San Francisco.  Emerge is an organization that focuses on electing more Democratic women within the California political landscape.

While her speech largely focused on the policies put into place during Trump's first 100 days in office, she concluded it by telling the audience, "Always remember this country is ours. It doesn’t belong to whoever is in the White House. It belongs to you. It belongs to us. It belongs to We The People.”

title: Alicia Keys Wears Beaded Headpiece At Met Gala Alongside Her Husband, Swizz Beatz
summary: Alicia Keys brought threads of history, heritage and personal legacy to the Met Gala when she arrived on the red carpet adorned in ruby red-beaded brilliance.
story: Alicia Keys brought threads of history, heritage and personal legacy to the Met Gala when she arrived on the red carpet adorned in ruby red-beaded brilliance.

The "Lifeline" singer appeared on the red carpet alongside her husband Swizz Beatz. The two wore complementary bright red and burgundy pin stripe suits, with Keys elevating her look with a puffer, floor-length shawl and a beaded headpiece. The look was designed by French-based fashion house Moncler.
Kpoene Kofi-Bruce, a designer and fashion historian, noted the duality in the couple’s Moncler ensembles to TODAY.com.

"Alicia is also referencing the Egyptian style with her hand-beaded headpiece," Kofi-Bruce said. "I love the way Moncler played with volume for both Alicia and Swizz Beats, creating a streamlined strapless peplum look and a strong-shouldered suit, and then also managed to create the illusion of a fluffy fur stole with the pinstriped material."
Kimberly Jenkins, a cultural scholar, applauded the singer for wearing her beaded crown with intention.

"The beaded headdress reminds me of the 1920s but then when I saw a more contextualized photo of her with her husband Swizz Beats, where he was wearing — similar to Teyana Taylor — a red durag, they kind of reminded me of an era in the 1970s where you would see the black man and woman standing together with this “Black is Beautiful” look," she commented. "They’re suiting, however, seemed to solidly reference the Harlem Renaissance once again."

title: Demi Moore's Met Gala gown is a necktie? See the look
summary: Demi Moore's 2025 Met Gala gown resembled a necktie.
story: Leave it to Demi Moore to loop in her own take at the Met Gala and pull it off.

For the Met Gala, the "Substance" actor stepped onto the red carpet in a sweeping black gown with white stripes and an architectural circular collar that appeared to transform a gown into a classic men's tie. The gown's bodice took on the form of a knot, while the lower portion of her dress reflected the neck of a tie. Paired with diamond bangles and drop diamond earrings, the look was all-out theatrical.
In a post on Instagram, the actor's daughter Tallulah Willis shared that her mother wore a look by Thom Browne.
"TIE IT UP WITH A BOW — SHES WON (again)," Tallulah Willis wrote in another post on Instagram.

A closer look at the gown reveals over 1.4 million beads — including 22,000 black rectangle sequins, 103,500 black cut beads, and 1,093,500 black bugle beads, according to Vogue. A team of artisans put in more than 7,600 hours to create the intricate couture look.

“Tonight is definitely Thom Browne’s night to shine, and this is a rare time when a designer and muse clearly got together and decided to have fun,” commented Kpoene’ Kofi-Nicklin,  the creative director of Mignonette Bridal. “When I think of formal menswear, a tie is an integral part of the look, so what better way to say ‘tailoring’ than coming as walking neckwear?”

title: How much does it cost to attend the Met Gala?
summary: What's the price of a Met Gala ticket in 2025? Learn more about ticket cost and tables.
story: The first Monday of May is reserved for fashion's most coveted night: The Met Gala. But how are the stars invited, and who pays to attend?

The 2025 Met Gala is set for May 5 to celebrate the spring 2025 exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s Costume Institute, “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style.” The exhibit is inspired by Barnard College professor Monica L. Miller’s 2009 book, “Slaves to Fashion: Black Dandyism and the Styling of Black Diasporic Identity.”

Stars will head to the Met in looks fitting the “Tailored For You” dress code, and the public will get to see who was invited as they make their way up the steps into the famed museum.

But the Met Gala has been shrouded in mystery beyond the star-studded red carpet. Guests must abide by a no-phone policy once they’re inside, and minimal photos are allowed inside the Met during the gala.
While the details on what happens inside the event are hazy, here’s what to know about who gets invited to the Met Gala, and how much it costs to attend.
How much does a ticket to the Met Gala cost?
An individual ticket to the Met Gala costs $75,000 in 2025, the Met confirmed to CBS News’ MoneyWatch.

This is the same price as last year, despite inflation woes in the U.S. The Met at the time had confirmed the 2024 ticket price to CBS News and also said a 10-person table that year started at $350,000.
The Met did not respond to multiple requests from TODAY.com about the price of a ticket to the 2025 gala.
How are people invited to the Met Gala?

The event is invite-only, however, and tickets are not available to purchase by the general public. Generally, companies like fashion labels purchase a table to host their preferred celebrities, the Associated Press reported.
What is the Met Gala raising money for?

The proceeds from the event go toward raising money for the Met’s Costume Institute. This year’s Met Gala raised a record $31 million, museum officials told The New York Times, the biggest fundraising total in the event’s 77-year history.
In 2024, the gala’s 400-person guest list raised nearly $22 million, according to the Associated Press.

title: Prince Louis steals the show at parade for V-E Day anniversary: 'Meme King-in-Chief himself'
summary: Prince Louis dusted off his dad's clothes and made some silly faces during the V-E Day parade in Britain.
story: Prince Louis is still doing Prince Louis things.
No stranger to stealing the spotlight, the prince did so again on May 5 during an event for the 80th anniversary of V-E Day in Britain, which marks the end of World War II in Europe.

During a military parade, which went past Buckingham Palace, Louis could be seen dusting off the military uniform worn by his father, Prince William, placing his right hand on his father’s shoulder and brushing it off.
One person even addressed the prince’s penchant for making headlines by sharing a clip on X and writing, “There he is, the Meme King-In-Chief himself, Prince Louis!”

Louis, who turned 7 last month, also stuck his tongue out during the parade and appeared to pout with a stern look on his face. In addition to his father, Louis was joined at the festivities by his mother, Catherine, Princess of Wales and his siblings, Prince George and Princess Charlotte.

For good measure, Louis also mimicked his older brother, as seen in one clip, who flipped his hair at one point. After seeing George do so, Louis did an exaggerated version of the act, while George looked on. At another moment, he was also caught rolling his eyes.

Louis has performed similar antics at other royal events. He made some funny expressions in June 2023 during the annual “Trooping the Colour” parade outside Buckingham Palace, and a month earlier, he showed off his comical expressions at his grandfather King Charles III’s coronation ceremony.

title: Rihanna is pregnant with baby No. 3, A$AP Rocky confirms on Met Gala carpet
summary: Rihanna is pregnant! Her partner, ASAP Rocky, confirmed the news on the Met Gala 2025 carpet.
story: Rihanna is pregnant!
The star and entrepreneur is expecting baby No. 3, her partner, A$AP Rocky, confirmed ahead of her appearance at the Met Gala on May 5, 2025, in New York City.
“Rihanna’s outfit tonight is ... I don’t know, whatever, just don’t cover her baby hump, you dig?” he said in an interview on the carpet.

A$AP Rocky didn't quite get his wish as Rihanna arrived wearing a cropped jacket with a crossover necktie and a gray corseted top that did cover the "baby hump." The floor-length skirt also appeared to be a play on a suit jacket. She completed the look with a wide-brim black hat.

Before Rihanna walked over to speak with TODAY's Al Roker, an onlooker called out to ask if she'd brought her "umbrella-ella-ella, eh" — a play on her hit 2007 single "Umbrella." Rihanna playfully responded: "I brought the kid!"

Before her arrival at the Met, celebrity photographer Miles Diggs — who also photographed Rihanna's reveal of her first child — shared a photo on Instagram of the singer baring her stomach while wearing a gray top and matching skirt and boots.

Rihanna first ignited rumors that she was expecting earlier in the evening when she arrived at The Carlyle hotel on Manhattan's Upper East Side (a popular spot for celebrities to prepare for the Met Gala).

This isn't the first time she made headlines with a major pregnancy reveal. When Rihanna headlined the 2023 Super Bowl halftime show, she did so by wearing an all-red outfit that showed off a baby bump, hinting to viewers that she was pregnant — a detail she confirmed to NBC News after the performance.
She often gushes about motherhood, saying in 2023 to Access Hollywood that she hopes to break "generational curses" as she raises her children.

“You just hope, ‘I can have kids one day and I hope I can have them in love, and I hope that I can be a part of a family that breaks generational curses and moves forward and does new things and raises our kids better than we were raised and all the beautiful things,’” she said.
“And it’s happening, and I can’t believe it.”
In an April 2024 interview with Interview Magazine, Rihanna said she would “try for my girl” if she had more children. “But of course if it’s another boy, it’s another boy.”

title: Bad Bunny announces dates for international stadium tour
summary: After announcing his Puerto Rico concert residency, Bad Bunny has announced his Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour. See the full list of dates and cities here.
story: Bad Bunny is gearing up for a global stadium tour.
The Puerto Rican superstar, 31, announced May 5 in a press release that he will embark on a world tour in support of his sixth studio album, "Debí Tirar Más Fotos," released in January.
The tour is set to kick off Nov. 21 in Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic. Bad Bunny will continue performing throughout Latin America, before traveling to Europe, Australia, Japan and London.
The tour will conclude in Brussels, Belgium, on July 22, 2026.

The tour for “Debí Tirar Más Fotos” — which translates to “I should have taken more photos" — will "bring the album to life, fully immersing audiences in its world, celebrating the essence and culture of Bad Bunny’s Puerto Rican heritage," the release said.
The album debuted in the No. 1 spot on Billboard’s top streaming albums chart and has produced several hit singles.
Tickets for the 23-date stadium tour, which is presented by Live Nation and Rimas Nation, go on sale May 9 at DePuertoRicoPalMundo.com.

The announcement of the world tour comes as Bad Bunny, whose real name is Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio, prepares to launch his previously announced 30-date residency at the Coliseo de Puerto Rico José Miguel Agrelot in his native Puerto Rico.
The residency, titled "No me quiero ir de aquí" — or “I do not want to leave here" —  kicks off July 11 and concludes Sept. 14.

When does Bad Bunny’s world tour start?
Bad Bunny's "Debí Tirar Más Fotos" world tour kicks off Nov. 21 in Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic.

The tour will bring the Puerto Rican's chart-topping sixth studio album, “Debí Tirar Más Fotos," which translates to “I should have taken more photos,” to life, while celebrating the rapper and singer's Puerto Rican heriage.
